text.p: Amgen Inc said Monday that Phase I trials of the leptin protein found that it had "an acceptable safety profile" and induced weight loss at certain dose levels.
The comany said it will begin Phase II clinical trials to further evaluate the safety and efficacy of leptin in treating obesity.

Amgen Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Gordon Binder said the company was "very encouraged" by the early trial data. The company also said it will soon begin a Phase II safety and efficacy trial of leptin in obese patients with Type II diabetes.
Amgen said the preliminary analysis of the trial data "indicated a dose range in which leptin appeard to be safe and reasonably well tolerated in most subjects."
It said that at higher doses, there were adverse side effects at the injection site that "exceeded the level of acceptability for many subjects."
